title: SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: The SaveAs function in the application is not retaining the file type when saving a file. Additionally, the icon for the saved file has changed from the original Java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
1) Open an existing Java file.
2) Make some modifications to the file (e.g., move an existing class).
3) Click on the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save icon.
4) A dialog box will appear.
5) Browse for a valid container location to save the file.
6) Type the filename but ignore the extension prompt that is not requested.
7) Click Okay.

Observed Behavior:
After saving the file, the file appears in the specified location in the Navigator panel without any file extension displayed.
EB: The saved file should retain the same extension as the original file, unless explicitly changed during the SaveAs operation.
SR:
1) Open the application.
2) Open an existing Java file.
3) Make some modifications to the Java file (e.g., move an existing class).
4) Click on the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save icon.
5) A dialog box should appear.
6) Browse for a valid container location to save the file.
7) Type the filename but ignore the extension prompt that is not requested.
8) Click Okay.
9) Verify that the saved file appears in the specified location in the Navigator panel with the correct file extension.
